page.title: 11Hodroyd Farm
page.content: Hodroyd Farm,Felkirk is owned by Mr and Mrs Jenkinson.They rent 180 acres from the N.C.B. and the fields are divided as follows: 135 acres under grass,12 acres peas,3 acres oats,15 acres wheat,15 acres barley. The live-stock,which consists of 31 heifers,7 bullocks,12 ewes,and 5 lambs are kept for fattening then sent to be sold at market in Doncaster,Barnsley or Otley.At hay making time Mr. Jenkinson has his own baler to bale hay but also hires a contractor to bale large rolls. They have 2 to 3 local people to help at hay making and harvest time.Large supplies of hay are sold to other farmers for winter feeding. Some hay and all the barley they keep for their own stock.The pea fields are rented out to other people. Once harvested the wheat is sold to a food manufacturer.
